subject: Web3
title: The Quiet Survival of NFTs
description: A fast breakdown of The Quiet Survival of NFTs for builders.

hook.text: Headlines declared NFTs dead after the crash. Behind the scenes, the technology kept evolving.

buildup.text: Starbucks launched NFT loyalty rewards. Nike built a Web3 platform. Reddit distributed millions of NFT avatars.

discovery.text: The difference: these companies didn't call them NFTs. They used terms like 'digital collectibles.'

twist.text: The word 'NFT' became toxic. The technology works fine â€” the branding is what failed.

climax.text: NFTs may succeed by becoming invisible. When you stop noticing the blockchain, that's when it's won.

punchline.text: NFTs aren't dead. They just dropped the name.

quiz.question: How are companies using NFT technology after the crash?
options: They use the technology but call it 'digital collectibles' instead
